job_title: Media Specialist in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Loved working here. The supervisors were fantastic and coworkers became good friends. Work wasn’t too hard and hours were flexible.

job_title: Lead Automotive Technician in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The culture is very welcoming, supportive and collaborative.
cons: Pay is much lower than the industry and it does not currently offer competitive benefits.

job_title: Maintenance Technician in Fort Worth, TX
pros: I enjoyed the people that I worked with as my co-laborers.
cons: I did not like the inconsistency that happened here with the leadership in the upper head.

job_title: Staff Photographer in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great team to work with
cons: Non profit org so pay might not be as competitive as for profit

job_title: Freelance Transcriber in Fort Worth, TX

job_title: AV Specialist in Fort Worth, TX

pros: Enjoyed my time at the seminary. Was a student while I worked and they were great about working with my ever-changing schedule.

job_title: Employment and Benefits Specialist in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The people you work with, for the most part, are amazing!

job_title: Not Applicable in Crowley, TX

review_title: Okay employment for students, but not for a career
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: There is a friendly work environment with coworkers.
cons: The Administration is committed to adding buildings to the campus, even building the current President a massive home to retire at on campus, but has not provided cost of living pay increases in many years. At the same time, benefits such as paid holidays are fewer each year. One odd recent policy is that vacation days taken adjacent to a holiday deduct twice as many paid vacation hours.

job_title: Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: on campus job while at school
cons: terrible pay and job security

review_title: Great place to work, if you are called here
job_title: in Fort Worth, TX
pros: There is not nearly as much pressure to perform as there is in the real world.  This creates an easy-going atmosphere.
cons: This easy-going atmosphere masks serious issues.  With no review process and thus no incentives for high performance, salary is divorced from performance.  If you're a high-performer, you'll learn quickly to slow down or get frustrated and leave.  If you're a slacker, you won't be reprimanded and will love the easy-going atmosphere.

review_title: Nice co-workers, but pay is low enough to be immoral, and you have reason to fear layoffs.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Nice co-workers in a generally pleasant day-to-day atmosphere.
cons: There are some very odd and seemingly arbitrary rules (like the dress code) that change almost on a whim, and the pay was extremely low--barely over minimum wage in a skilled job that required advanced education. Many students I encountered were openly disrespectful of women, although this was not an issue I had with my immediate supervisors or co-workers.

review_title: Administration appears desensatized to a demoralized working atmosphere due to minimal financial advancement.
job_title: Professor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The classroom opportunities and the support of other faculty are the best reasons for teaching at Southwestern and living in Fort Worth.
cons: There is no clear statement for advancement, employee's job proformance is seldom more than satisfactory (despite objective evidence to the contrary), and the very poor communication from administration.

review_title: Great to be a part of what the Lord is doing at Southwestern.
job_title: in Fort Worth, TX
pros: It's great to work at a place with like-minded people in their love for the Lord and a desire to see people hear and receive the Gospel.
cons: There isn't much room for advancement. Which isn't a problem for those who are planning to leave after they complete their degree, but for others it can be discouraging to be stuck in a low-level position.

review_title: Flexible with classes, but not sufficient to support your family.
job_title: in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great coworkers and some great supervisors. Friendly atmosphere at the lower levels. Flexible with classes.
cons: Low pay, raises rare, little room for advancement, little to no genuine appreciation from upper management, and every year your compensation gets worse in some way or other (e.g. hours cut, PTO program abolished).

review_title: Awesome place to work and go to school
job_title: Childcare in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Christian atmosphere, Biblically based, supportive, casual but professional atmosphere, you feel loved and appreciated
cons: When you turn a professor in for verbal and emotional abuse, you have to take it all the way up to the President before anybody will listen to you.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: There are a lot of kind and helpful people who work there.  They are very flexible for people with families.
cons: There is not a lot of room for career growth, also due to it being a privately-funded institution the pay is very minimal.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Scheduling is usually considerate of personal/study time; employer tries hard to employ students and assign as many hours as possible
cons: Some important links of communication are hard to maintain here.

review_title: Great people with the love of God
